Dear Ms. Carey:
Attached is the Interim Inspection Report for the above referenced agency completed on
3/8/2024. Due to the violations of applicable licensing rules, a written corrective action
plan is required. The corrective action plan is due 15 days from the date of this letter and
must include the following:
• For any repeat violations, why the prior corrective action plan did not result
in compliance.
• How compliance with each citation will be achieved.
• Who is directly responsible for implementing the corrective action plan.
• Specific time frames for each citation as to when the correction will be
completed or implemented.
• How continuing compliance will be maintained once compliance is
achieved.
• The signature of the responsible party and a date.
Please review the enclosed documentation for accuracy and contact me with any
questions. In the event that I am not available, and you need to speak to someone
immediately, please contact Samanatha Way area manager at 517-243 -9743.

III. DESCRIPTION OF FINDINGS

following:
CPA Rule 400.12418 Development of service plans
(2) An agency shall complete written service
plans for each child and parent or

(a) Within 30 calendar days from
removal from the home.
One of one independent living case files reviewed was not completed within 30
days.
CPA Rule 400.12418 Development of service plans
(2) An agency shall complete written service
plans for each child and parent or
parents, as follows:
(b) Within 120 calendar days after the
initial removal and at least once
every 90 calendar days thereafter.

VI. EVALUATION OF PERIOD UNDER REVIEW
There were no substantiated incidents of maltreatment in care during this licensing
period.
3

There were no incidents of substantiated corporal punishment during this licensing
period.
Corrective Action Plan Compliance
The agency has submitted 1 acceptable corrective action plan (CAP) during this
licensing period, and compliance with the individual CAP is as follows: The agency
submitted one acceptable corrective action plan in response to the renewal
inspection completed 4/3/2023 with a corrective action plan approved on 4/5/2023.
During the review period the agency had three violations. They were CPA Rules
400. 12509 3 (n), 400.12509 3 (o) and FOM Policy 801-03 Medical Passport.
During this reporting period under review, the agency did not have any repeat
violations and contributed their success to following their corrective action plan
from their last inspection.
Chief Administrator Assessment
The Chief Administrator (CA) and this Consultant discussed the Chief
Administrator Assessment (CAA) while onsite on 3/7/2024. The barrier the CA
discussed were the high number of placement crises over the past review period.
The high number of placement crises added to the job stressors and somewhat
impacted the ability to comply with the licensing rules. The CA reported the
agency has restructured positions by separating the dual position of case manager
and house supervisor to allow time for case managers to focus on managing
cases alone and not supervising independent living direct care staff. The CA
reported a Program Manager was hired to supervise the direct care staff. The CA
provided a review of the corrective action plan for the renewal evaluation
completed on 4/3/23 and an assessment of the key performance indicators.
The CA expressed confidence that several areas will improve over the next review
period.
Financial Overview
The agency Independent Auditors’ Report dated 9/30/22 and the annual financial
budget report were reviewed. No financial concerns were identified.
Staff Interviews
The staff interviewed all reported receiving the supervision and support needed to
learn and complete their job responsibilities. No concerns were reported.
4

Description of Agency Walk Through
The agency has adequate space and equipment to complete required
responsibilities. Files and CHRI are stored securely in a manner that prevent
unauthorized access within metal locked cabinets and drawers and behind locked
doors.
VII. FIELD ANALYST FINDINGS
N/A
VIII. RECOMMENDATION
Based on inspection findings the agency is not in compliance with all applicable
licensing statutes and rules. Upon receipt of an acceptable corrective action plan, it
is recommended that the agency continue on their regular license.
